title: Coimbatore: Man dupes elderly woman of gold, mobile phone, held
text: COIMBATORE: The city police arrested a 43-year-old man after he robbed a 65-year-old woman of her gold ornaments weighing 7.5 sovereign and other belongings at the Coimbatore Medical College and Hospital (CMCH) on Tuesday.Police identified the accused as M Krishnakumar, a resident of Sundarapuram. “The accused noticed G Palaniammal alone at the hospital. He initiated a conversation with her and told her that the government is assisting senior citizens to meet out their medical expenses upon submitting an application form. Before meeting a doctor to get a form, he told her to remove her ornaments as the doctor may suspect her to be wealthy,” a police officer said.Believing the accused, Palaniammal handed over her ornaments, a mobile phone and Rs 200 to him and went to see the doctor, the officer said. “When she came back, the accused had escaped with the items.”Realising that she had been duped, Palaniammal informed her son G Mohanasundaram. He came to the hospital, took her to the Race Course police station and lodged a complaint.Based on the complaint, the police traced the accused and arrested him on the same day. Later, he was produced before a judicial magistrate, who remanded him in judicial custody.In another incident, the Bazaar police arrested S Suresh, 38, a resident of Kollam district in Kerala for stealing a gold chain weighing three sovereign from a man while travelling in a town bus near Podhanur. Police made the arrest based on a complaint from M Pradiponnu Gurus, who lost the Rs 75,000 worth chain. The accused was later lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison.
